Title: PredictionX: Omens
URL: This course is an overview of divination systems, ranging from ancient Chinese bone burning to modern astrology. It explores pre-scientific" prediction systems and theoretical frameworks connecting them."
Prerequisites: Robert Wheeler Willson Professor of Applied Astronomy at Harvard University
column8: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: Social Sciences; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 1 week, 3-5 hours per week; Part of PredictionX XSeries Program

Title: PredictionX: Lost Without Longitude
Description: Explore the history of navigation from stars to satellites.
Instructor's Bio: Robert Wheeler Willson Professor of Applied Astronomy at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: History; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 1 week, 2-5 hours per week; Part of PredictionX XSeries Program

Title: PredictionX: John Snow and the Cholera Epidemic of 1854
Description: An in-depth look at the 1854 London cholera epidemic in Soho and its importance for the field of epidemiology.
Instructor's Bio: Robert Wheeler Willson Professor of Applied Astronomy at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: History; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 1 week, self-paced; Part of PredictionX XSeries Program

Title: Shakespeare and His World
Description: Explore the life, works, and times of William Shakespeare, from his birthplace in Stratford-upon-Avon to the London playhouses.
Instructor's Bio: John Cogan University Professor of the Humanities at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: Literature; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 4 weeks, 3-5 hours per week; Part of Shakespeare XSeries Program

Title: Rhetoric: The Art of Persuasive Writing and Public Speaking
Description: Gain critical communication skills in writing and public speaking with this introduction to American political rhetoric.
Instructor's Bio: Gurney Professor of English and Professor of Comparative Literature at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: Humanities; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 8 weeks, 2-3 hours per week; Part of Professional Certificate in Leadership and Communication

Title: Building your Screenplay
Description: Learn to strengthen your skills as a screenwriter, while diversifying your knowledge and understanding of the demands of global film and TV production.
Instructor's Bio: Course Director at Institute of Continuing Education University of Cambridge
Additional Information: Institution: University of Cambridge; Subject: Communication; Level: Intermediate; Language: English; Length: 4 weeks, 8-10 hours per week; Part of MicroMasters® Program in Writing for Performance and the Entertainment Industries

Title: Ancient Masterpieces of World Literature
Description: Examine how cultures of the ancient world defined themselves through literature and how their vision of literature contributes to our understanding of civilization, culture, and literature today.
Instructor's Bio: Martin Puchner: Byron and Anita Wien Professor of Drama and of English and Comparative Literature at Harvard University. David Damrosch: Ernest Bernbaum Professor of Literature at Harvard University.
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: Literature; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 6 weeks, 3-6 hours per week; Associated skills: Collections, Writing

Title: First Nights - Monteverdi's L'Orfeo and the Birth of Opera
Description: Learn about Claudio Monteverdi's L'Orfeo, one of the first operas ever written.
Instructor's Bio: Morton B. Knafel Professor of Music at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: Humanities; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 3 weeks, 3-5 hours per week; Part of XSeries in Classical Works

Title: Dante Alighieri: Science and poetry in The Divine Comedy
Description: Explore Dante's Divine Comedy through a discussion of the sources and references of the poetry and modern science
Instructor's Bio: Professor at Università di Napoli Federico II
Additional Information: Institution: FedericaX; Subject: Literature; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 4 weeks, 8-10 hours per week

Title: Pyramids of Giza: Ancient Egyptian Art and Archaeology
Description: Explore the archaeology, history, art, and hieroglyphs surrounding the famous Egyptian Pyramids at Giza. Learn about Old Kingdom pharaohs and elites, tombs, temples, the Sphinx, and how new technology is unlocking their secrets.
Instructor's Bio: Barbara Bell Professor of Egyptology at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: Art & Culture; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 8 weeks, 2-4 hours per week; Associated skills: Archaeology, 3D Modeling
